dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (reading the program) Ooh! Look! Look! Look! Look, there's Joey's picture! This is so exciting!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: You can always spot someone who's never seen one of his plays before. Notice, no fear, no sense of impending doom...

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: The exclamation point in the title scares me. (Gesturing) Y'know, it's not just Freud , it's Freud!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh, shhh, shh. Magic is about to happen.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Vell, Eva, ve've done some excellent vork here, and I vould have to say, your pwoblem is qviiite clear. (He goes into a song and dance number.)

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: The Theater, the play has ended and everyone is applauding.  As soon as
the cast leaves, the gang all groan and sit down heavily.]

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: God. I feel violated.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Did anybody else feel they just wanted to peel the skin off their body, to have something else to do?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (staring at a woman across the room) Ross, ten o'clock.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Is it? Feels like two.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: No, ten o'clock .

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (sighs and gestures to explain) There's a beautiful woman at eight, nine, ten o'clock!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh. Hel-lo!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: She's amazing! She makes the women that I dream about look like short, fat, bald men!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Well, go over to her! She's not with anyone.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh yeah, and what would my opening line be? 'Excuse me. Blarrglarrghh.'

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, c'mon. She's a person, you can do it!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh please, could she be more out of my league? Ross, back me up here.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: He could never get a woman like that in a million years.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Thank you, buddy.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, oh, but y'know, you always see these really beautiful women with these really nothing guys, you could be one of those guys.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: You could do that!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Y'think?

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Yeah!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh God, I can't believe I'm even considering this... I'm very very aware of my tongue...

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: C'mon! C'mon!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Here goes. (He walks over to her but just stands there.)

dialogue.speaker: AURORA
dialogue.text: ...Yes?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Hi.... um... okay, next word... would be... Chandler! Chandler is my name, and, uh...(He clears his throat noisily)...hi.

dialogue.speaker: AURORA
dialogue.text: Yes, you said that.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yes, yes I did, but what I didn't say was what I was about to say, what I wanted to say was, uh... would you like to go out with me sometime, thankyou, goodnight. (He walks back to the others but she calls him back.)

dialogue.speaker: AURORA
dialogue.text: Chandler?

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Hey! You're in a play! I didn't know you could dance! You had a beard!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Whadja think?

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: ...Hey! You're in a play! I didn't know you could dance! You had a beard!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: C'mon, you guys, it wasn't that bad. It was better than that thing I did with the trolls, at least you got to see my head.

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: (admitting) Saw your head. Saw your head.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (running back) She said yes!! She said yes!! (To Joey) Awful play, man. Whoah. (To All) Her name's Aurora, and she's Italian, and she pronounces my name 'Chand-lrr'. 'Chand-lrr'. I think I like it better that way. (To Joey) Oh, listen, the usher gave me this to give to you. (He fishes a card out of his pocket.)

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: What is it?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: The Estelle Leonard Talent Agency. Wow, an agency left me its card! Maybe they wanna sign me!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Based on this play ? ...Based on this play!

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Central Perk, everyone else is there as Chandler enters.]

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Hey, kids.

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Hey.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (reading Monica's palm) No, 'cause this line is passion, and this is... just a line.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Well, I can't believe I've been here almost seven seconds and you haven't asked me how my date went.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh, right, right. How was your date, 'Chand-lrr'?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: It was unbelievable. I-I've never met anyone like her. She's had the most amazing life! She was in the Israeli army...

dialogue.speaker: AURORA
dialogue.text: ...Luckily none of the bullets hit the engine block. So, we made it to the border, but just barely, and I- ...I've been talking about myself all night long, I'm sorry. What about you? Tell me one of your stories.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Alright. Once I got on the subway, right, and it was at night, and I rode it all the way to Brooklyn... just for the hell of it.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: We talked 'til like two. It was this perfect evening... more or less.

dialogue.speaker: AURORA
dialogue.text: ...All of a sudden we realised we were in Yammon.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh, I'm sorry, so 'we' is?

dialogue.speaker: AURORA
dialogue.text: 'We' would be me and Rick.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Who's Rick?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Who's Rick?

dialogue.speaker: AURORA
dialogue.text: My husband.

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Ooooohhh.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh, so you're divorced?

dialogue.speaker: AURORA
dialogue.text: No.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh, I'm sorry, then you're widowed?...Hopefully?

dialogue.speaker: AURORA
dialogue.text: No, I'm still married.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: So tell me, how do- how do you think your husband would feel about you sitting here with me?...Sliding your foot so far up my pant leg you can count the change in my pocket?

dialogue.speaker: AURORA
dialogue.text: Don't worry. I imagine he'd be okay with you because really, he's okay with Ethan.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Ethan? There's, there's an Ethan?

dialogue.speaker: AURORA
dialogue.text: Mmmm... Ethan is my... boyfriend.

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: What?!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: So explain something to me here, uh, what kind of a relationship do you imagine us having if you already have a husband and a boyfriend?

dialogue.speaker: AURORA
dialogue.text: I suppose mainly sexual.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh. I'm sorry it didn't work out.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: What 'not work out'? I'm seeing her again on Thursday. Didn't you listen to the story?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Didn't you listen to the story? I mean, this is twisted! How could you get involved with a woman like this?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Well, y'know, I had some trouble with it at first too, but the way I look at it is,

dialogue.speaker: I GET ALL THE GOOD STUFF
dialogue.text: all the fun, all the talking, all the sex; and none of the responsibility. I mean, this is every guy's fantasy!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, yeah. That is not true. Ross, is this your fantasy?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No, of course not! (Thinks) ...Yeah, yeah, it is.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: What? So you guys don't mind going out with someone else who's going out with someone else?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: I couldn't do it.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Good for you, Joey.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: When I'm with a woman, I need to know that I'm going out with more people than she is.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Well, y'know, monogamy can be a, uh, tricky concept. I mean, anthropologically speaking-

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Fine. Fine, alright, now you'll never know.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: We're kidding. C'mon, tell us!

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Yeah! C'mon!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Alright. There's a theory, put forth by Richard Leakey-

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel is there as enter except Joey enter.]

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Tah-daaah!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Are we greeting each other this way now? 'Cause I like that.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Look! I cleaned! I did the windows, I did the floors... I even used all the attachments on the vacuum, except that little round one with the bristles, I don't know what that's for.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh yeah, nobody knows. And we're not supposed to ask.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Well, whaddya think?

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Very clean! It looks great! Terrific!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: ...Oh! I-I see you moved the green ottoman.

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Uh-oh...

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: How-how did that happen?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I dunno.. I-I thought it looked better there. And I- and also, it's an extra seat around the coffee table.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Yeah, yeah, it's interesting.. but y'know what? Just for fun, let's see what it looked like in the old spot. (She moves it.) Alright, just to compare. Let's see. Well, it looks good there too. Let's just leave it there for a while.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (to Rachel) I can't believe you tried to move the green ottoman.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Thank God you didn't try to fan out the magazines. I mean, she'll scratch your eyes right out.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: You guys, I am not that bad!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yeah, you are, Monica. Remember when I lived with you? You were like, a little, y'know, (psycho) Ree! Ree! Ree! Ree!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: That is so unfair!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh c'mon! When we were kids, yours was the only Raggedy Ann doll that wasn't raggedy!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Okay, so I'm responsible, I'm organised. But hey, I can be a kook.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Alright, you madcap gal. Try to imagine this. The phone bill arrives, but you don't pay it right away.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Why not?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Because you're a kook! Instead you wait until they send you a notice.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I could do that.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Okay, uh, you let me go grocery shopping, and I buy laundry detergent, but it's not the one with the easy-pour spout.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Why would someone do that?! ...One might wonder.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Someone's left a glass on the coffee table. There's no coaster. It's a cold drink, it's a hot day. Little beads of condensation are inching their way closer and closer to the surface of the wood...

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: STOP IT!! ...Oh my God. It's true! Who am I?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Monica? You're Mom.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Ree! Ree! Ree! Ree! Ree!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (on phone) Uh huh.. uh huh... oh my God! Okay! Okay, I'll be there! (He hangs up and to all.) That was my agent. (He tosses and catches the phone.) My agent has just gotten me a job...in the new Al Pacino movie!

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Oh my God! Whoah!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Well, what's the part?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Can you believe this? Al Pacino! This guy's the reason I became an actor! "I'm out of order? Pfeeeh. You're out of order! This whole courtroom's out of order!"

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Seriously, what-what's the part?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: "Just when I thought I was out, they pull me back in!"

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: C'mon, seriously, Joey, what's the part?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: ...I'm his (mumbles)

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: ..You're, you're 'mah mah mah' what?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: ...I'm his butt double. 'Kay? I play Al Pacino's butt. Alright? He goes into the shower, and then- I'm his butt.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (trying not to laugh) Oh my God.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: C'mon, you guys. This is a real movie, and Al Pacino's in it, and that's big!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh no, it's terrific, it's... it's... y'know, you deserve this, after all your years of struggling, you've finally been able to crack your way into showbusiness.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Okay, okay, fine! Make jokes, I don't care! This is a big break for me!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: You're right, you're right, it is...So you gonna invite us all to the big opening?

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, the next morning, Monica is getting the door.]

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Alright, alright, alright...

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Here. I need to borrow some moisturizer.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: For what?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Whaddya think? Today's the big day!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh my God. Okay, go into the bathroom, use whatever you want, just don't ever tell me what you did in there.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Thank you! (He goes into the bathroom.)

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Where's Joey? His mom's on the phone.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: He's in the bathroom. I don't think you wanna go in there!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: C'mon, we're roommates! (He goes into the bathroom, screams, and runs back out.) My eyes!! My eyes!!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I warned you...

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Who is being loud?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh, that would be Monica. Hey, listen, I wanna borrow a coupla things, Aurora spent the night, I really wanna make her breakfast.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh, you got the whole night, huh?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yeah, well, I only have twenty minutes until Ethan, so, y'know.. (He starts to raid the fridge.)

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Ooh, do I sense a little bit of resentment?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: No, no resentment, believe me, it's worth it. 'Kay? Y'know in a relationship you have these key moments that you know you'll remember for the rest of your life? Well, every- single- second is like that with Aurora.. and I've just wasted about thirty-five of them talking to you people, so, uh.. Monica, can you help me with the door? (He has armloads of stuff.)

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Sure. Oh, um, Chandler? Y'know, the-the old Monica would-would remind you to scrub that Teflon pan with a plastic brush...But I'm not gonna do that.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: A Film Set, Joey is entering for his scene.]

dialogue.speaker: DIRECTOR
dialogue.text: (on phone)...Dammit, hire the girl! (He hangs up the phone.) Okay, everybody ready?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Uh, listen, I just wanna thank you for this great opportunity.

dialogue.speaker: DIRECTOR
dialogue.text: Lose the robe.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Me?

dialogue.speaker: DIRECTOR
dialogue.text: That would work.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Right. Okay. Losing the robe. (He takes off the robe.) And the robe is lost.

dialogue.speaker: DIRECTOR
dialogue.text: Okay, everybody, we'd like to get this in one take, please. Let's roll it.. water's working (The shower starts).. and... action.

dialogue.speaker: DIRECTOR
dialogue.text: And cut. Hey, Butt Guy, what the hell are you doing?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Well, I'm- I'm showering.

dialogue.speaker: DIRECTOR
dialogue.text: No, that was clenching.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Oh. Well, the way I see it, the guy's upset here, y'know? I mean, his wife's dead, his brother's missing... I think his butt would be angry here.

dialogue.speaker: DIRECTOR
dialogue.text: I think his butt would like to get this shot before lunch. Once again, rolling... water working... and action....and cut. What was that?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: I was going for quiet desperation. But if you have to ask...

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Aurora and Chandler are in bed in Chandler's room.]

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: God, I love these fingers...

dialogue.speaker: AURORA
dialogue.text: Thank you.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: No, actually I meant my fingers. Look at 'em, look at how happy they are.

dialogue.speaker: AURORA
dialogue.text: (moves Chandler's arm and look at his watch.) Oh my God, I'm late. (She starts to get up.)

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh no nonononononnononono, don't go.. (He kisses her and pulls her back down.)

dialogue.speaker: AURORA
dialogue.text: Okay.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Don't go.

dialogue.speaker: AURORA
dialogue.text: Okay. Oh no, I have to.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (to himself) Too bad, she's leaving.

dialogue.speaker: AURORA
dialogue.text: (getting up and dressing) I'm sorry. He'll be waiting for me.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Well, I thought- I thought you talked to Rick.

dialogue.speaker: AURORA
dialogue.text: It's not Rick.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: What, Ethan? He got to spend the whole day with you!

dialogue.speaker: AURORA
dialogue.text: No, it's-it's Andrew.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I know there'll be many moments in the years to come when I'll regret asking the following question, but- And Andrew is?

dialogue.speaker: AURORA
dialogue.text: He's... new.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Oh, so what you're saying is you're not completely fulfilled by Rick, Ethan and myself?

dialogue.speaker: AURORA
dialogue.text: No, that's not exactly what I was..

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Well, y'know, most women would kill for three guys like us.

dialogue.speaker: AURORA
dialogue.text: So what do you want?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: You.

dialogue.speaker: AURORA
dialogue.text: You have me!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Nono, just you.

dialogue.speaker: AURORA
dialogue.text: Whaddyou mean?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Lose the other guys.

dialogue.speaker: AURORA
dialogue.text: ...Like, ...all of them?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: C'mon, we're great together, why not?

dialogue.speaker: AURORA
dialogue.text: Why can't we just have what we have now? Why can't we just talk, and laugh, and make love, without feeling obligated to one another... and up until tonight I thought that's what you wanted too.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: ...Well, y'know, part of me wants that, but it's like I'm two guys, y'know? I mean, one guy's going 'Shut up! This is great!' But there's this other guy. Actually it's the same guy that wells up every time that Grinch's heart grows three sizes and breaks that measuring device... And he's saying, y'know, 'This is too hard! Get out! Get out!'

dialogue.speaker: AURORA
dialogue.text: So... which one of the two guys will you listen to?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: I don't know, I-I have to listen to both of them, they don't exactly let each other finish...

dialogue.speaker: AURORA
dialogue.text: Which one?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: ...The second guy.

dialogue.speaker: AURORA
dialogue.text: (gets up to leave) Well, call me if you change your mind.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Sorry, the first guy runs the lips.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Ross is trying to comfort Chandler.  Joey is absent.]

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: LOOK AT IT THIS WAY you dumped her . Right? I mean, this woman was unbelievably sexy, and beautiful, intelligent, unattainable... Tell me why you did this again?

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Hey!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Hey, waitwait, aren't you the guy that plays the butt in the new Al Pacino movie?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Nope.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: No? What happened, big guy?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (to Ross) "Big guy?"

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: It felt like a 'big guy' moment.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: I got fired.

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Oh!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yeah, they said I acted too much with it. I told everybody about this! Now everybody's gonna go to the theatre, expecting to see me, and...

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, Joey, you know what, no-one is gonna be able to tell.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: My mom will.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Something so sweet and...disturbing about that.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Y'know, I've done nothing but crappy plays for six years. And I finally get my shot, and I blow it!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Maybe this wasn't your shot.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yeah, I mean... I think when it's your shot, y'know, you-you know it's your shot. Did it... feel like your shot..?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Hard to tell, I was naked.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: No, I don't think this was your shot. I mean, I don't even think you just get one shot. I really believe big things are gonna happen for you, I do! You've gotta just keep thinking about the day that some kid is gonna run up to his friends and go 'I got the part! I got the part! I'm gonna be Joey Tribbiani's ass!'.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yeah? That's so nice! (They hug.)

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I'm sorry, Joey. I'm gonna go to bed, guys.

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Night.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Uh, Mon, you-you gonna leave your shoes out here?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (determined) Uh-huh!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Really? Just casually strewn about in that reckless haphazard manner?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Doesn't matter, I'll get 'em tomorrow. Or not. Whenever. (He goes to her room.)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: She is a kook.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica's Bedroom, she's lying in bed wide awake.]

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (hums for a while, then gives up, and in her head) If it bothers you that much, just go out and get the shoes. No. Don't do this. This is stupid! I don't have to prove anything, I'm gonna go get them...But then everyone will know. Unless I get them, and then wake up really early and put them back! ...I need help! (She buries her head in her pillow.)
